Interface RegressionInterface

public interface RegressionInterface

Inteface for a class that performs Linear Regression and Root Mean Square Deviation analysis on the data set. The getter methods getSlope(), getIntercept(), and getRMSD() is dependent on regress() being called first. If a getter is called before the value has been computed, it should throw a new InvalidDataException

Method Summary
 double getIntercept()
          returns the y-intercept of the line of best fit
 double getRMSD()
          returns the Root Mean Square Deviation of the line of best fit relative to the sample points x_data and y_data.
 double getSlope()
          returns the slope of the line of best fit.
 void regress(PointDouble[] points)
          Takes 2 double arrays and applies the linear regression formula to calculate the slope and y-intercept of the line of best fit
 

Method Detail

regress

void regress(PointDouble[] points)
Takes 2 double arrays and applies the linear regression formula to calculate the slope and y-intercept of the line of best fit

Parameters:
points - - the list of points perform regression on

getSlope

double getSlope()
                throws InvalidDataException
returns the slope of the line of best fit.

Returns:
- the value of the slope
Throws:
InvalidDataException - - if the value of slope has not been computed yet

getIntercept

double getIntercept()
                    throws InvalidDataException
returns the y-intercept of the line of best fit

Returns:
- the value of the y-intercept
Throws:
InvalidDataException - - if the value of the y-intercept has not been computed yet

getRMSD

double getRMSD()
               throws InvalidDataException
returns the Root Mean Square Deviation of the line of best fit relative to the sample points x_data and y_data. You can find the formula for RMSD in your assignment writeup.

Returns:
- the RMSD value of the line of best fit
Throws:
InvalidDataException - - if the line of best fit has not been computed yet
